csharp:abstract: Prevents a class from being instantiated directly - must be inherited
csharp:async: Marks a method as asynchronous - can use 'await' inside
csharp:await: Pauses execution until an async operation completes
csharp:class: Defines a blueprint for creating objects
csharp:const: A value that cannot change after compilation
csharp:delegate: A type that holds references to methods
csharp:enum: A set of named integer constants
csharp:interface: A contract that classes must implement
csharp:internal: Accessible only within the same assembly (DLL)
csharp:override: Replaces a method from a parent class
csharp:partial: Splits a class definition across multiple files
csharp:private: Accessible only within the same class
csharp:protected: Accessible within the class and its children
csharp:readonly: Can only be assigned once, at creation
csharp:static: Belongs to the class itself, not individual objects
csharp:struct: A lightweight value type (like a mini-class)
csharp:virtual: Can be overridden by child classes
csharp:volatile: May be modified by multiple threads
csharp:yield: Returns items one at a time from a collection
dotnet:List: A growable collection of items (like an array that can expand)
dotnet:Dictionary: A collection of key-value pairs (like a lookup table)
dotnet:HashSet: A collection of unique items (no duplicates)
dotnet:Action: A method that takes parameters but returns nothing
dotnet:Func: A method that takes parameters and returns a value
xpath://: Select all matching elements anywhere in the document
Go up to the parent element
xpath:ancestor: All parent elements going up the tree
xpath:descendant: All child elements going down the tree
xpath:following-sibling: Elements after this one at the same level
xpath:preceding-sibling: Elements before this one at the same level
game:EntityAlive: Base class for all living things (players, zombies, animals)
game:BlockValue: Represents a single block in the world
game:ItemClass: Defines an item's properties and behavior
game:ItemValue: A specific instance of an item (with durability, mods, etc.)
game:BuffClass: Defines a status effect (buff or debuff)
